name: Social Engineer Toolkit (SET)
summary: The Social-Engineer Toolkit (SET) is an open-source Python-driven framework designed for simulating social engineering attacks including spear phishing, credential harvesting, infectious media, and payload delivery for security awareness training and authorized penetration testing.

installation_guides.summary: Install via official repository or clone from GitHub.

steps.detail: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y git python3 python3-pip

installation_guides.summary: Pre-installed on Kali; update regularly for latest attack vectors.

steps.detail: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y set

installation_guides.summary: Run SET in isolated container for campaign management.

quick_examples.command: # SET > Social-Engineering Attacks > Website Attack Vectors > Credential Harvester
# SET > Social-Engineering Attacks > Infectious Media Generator
# SET > Social-Engineering Attacks > Spear-Phishing Attack Vectors > Mass Email

operational_tips: Always obtain explicit written authorization before running SET campaigns.
Use dedicated infrastructure with clean IP reputation for phishing simulations.
Test email templates against spam filters before mass deployment.
Educate targets after campaigns to improve security awareness.
Use realistic scenarios based on client's industry and threats.
Document all campaign parameters for reproducibility and reporting.
Clean up payloads, web servers, and email infrastructure after completion.
Monitor campaign metrics: open rates, click rates, credential submission.
Combine with payload frameworks like Metasploit for full exploitation chains.
Be aware of legal implications; misuse can result in criminal charges.

stages.label: Reconnaissance
stages.description: Research target organization, identify employees, gather email addresses.

stages.label: Infrastructure setup
stages.description: Register domain, setup email server, prepare payload hosting.
stages.command: # Register lookalike domain, configure SMTP, setup web hosting

stages.label: Payload creation
stages.description: Generate malicious attachment or credential harvester with SET.
stages.command: setoolkit # Generate fileformat payload or clone login page

stages.label: Pretext development
stages.description: Craft convincing email pretext based on target research.
stages.command: # Create email template: urgent IT alert, invoice, benefits update

stages.label: Campaign execution
stages.description: Send phishing emails to target list, monitor responses.
stages.command: # SET mass mailer or external SMTP tool

stages.label: Monitoring and response
stages.description: Track opens, clicks, credential submissions, shell callbacks.
stages.command: # Monitor SET console, Metasploit sessions, web logs

stages.label: Cleanup and reporting
stages.description: Shutdown infrastructure, document results, educate targets.
stages.command: # Stop listeners, remove payloads, generate metrics report

stages.label: Initial phishing
stages.description: Credential harvesting campaign to collect usernames/passwords.
stages.command: # SET credential harvester cloning login page

stages.label: Verify credentials
stages.description: Test collected credentials against target services.

stages.label: Payload delivery via email
stages.description: Send authenticated email with malicious attachment from compromised account.
stages.command: # Use harvested credentials to send from legitimate account

stages.label: Physical USB drop
stages.description: Deploy infectious media in parking lot or reception.
stages.command: # SET infectious media generator > create USB payloads

stages.label: Exploit multiple vectors
stages.description: Maximize chances of success with layered approach.
stages.command: # Combine email, physical, and phone-based pretexting

stages.label: Baseline assessment
stages.description: Measure current employee susceptibility to phishing.
stages.command: # Run simulated phishing campaign, track click rates

stages.label: Targeted training
stages.description: Educate employees who fell for simulation.
stages.command: # Security awareness training for vulnerable users

stages.label: Metrics and reporting
stages.description: Track improvement over time, report to management.
stages.command: # Generate metrics: click rate reduction, reporting rate increase

output_notes.meaning: Web server active, waiting for victims to submit credentials.

output_notes.indicator: [*] WE GOT A HIT! Printing the output:
output_notes.meaning: Victim submitted credentials; check console for username/password.
Malicious file generated successfully; ready for delivery.

output_notes.indicator: [!] Apache is not installed, would you like to install?
output_notes.meaning: Web server dependency missing; install Apache2 for web attacks.
Listener active for payload callbacks; monitor for incoming shells.

advanced_usage.title: Custom template development
advanced_usage.scenario: Create branded phishing templates for specific organizations.
advanced_usage.command:
# Edit templates in /usr/share/set/src/templates/
# Modify HTML/CSS to match target branding
notes: Clone real company login pages for authenticity.
Test rendering across browsers and email clients.
Include logos, colors, and language matching target.

advanced_usage.title: Integration with external SMTP
advanced_usage.scenario: Use external email service for better delivery rates.
advanced_usage.command:
# SET config.py: SENDMAIL = 'ON'
# Configure SMTP relay in /etc/ssmtp/ssmtp.conf
notes: Use compromised or lookalike domains for sender.
Configure SPF, DKIM, DMARC to bypass spam filters.
Warm up email sending IP before mass campaigns.

advanced_usage.title: Automation with SET command-line
advanced_usage.scenario: Automate campaign deployment for large-scale testing.
notes: Create config file with attack parameters.
Schedule via cron for recurring awareness tests.

advanced_usage.title: Payload obfuscation and evasion
advanced_usage.scenario: Evade AV and email gateway detection.
advanced_usage.command:
# Use custom encoders, encryption, or packing
# Veil-Evasion integration for advanced payloads
notes: Combine SET with Veil-Evasion for better evasion.
Use macro-enabled documents for Microsoft Office targets.

advanced_usage.title: Tracking and analytics
advanced_usage.scenario: Implement tracking pixels and link analytics for campaign metrics.
advanced_usage.command:
# Embed tracking images in emails
# Use URL shorteners with analytics (bitly, custom)
notes: Track email opens with 1x1 pixel images.
Monitor link clicks with custom redirect scripts.
Correlate metrics with user demographics for targeted training.
